content:
Yes, blockchain technology has the potential to level the playing field for independent creators who may not have the resources to fight copyright infringement. As digital content becomes more widespread and accessible, the issue of copyright infringement becomes more pressing, and it is often independent creators who are the most vulnerable to infringement.

By providing a transparent and immutable record of ownership and usage rights, blockchain technology can help independent creators protect their intellectual property rights and prevent unauthorized use or distribution of their work. By creating a new paradigm of automatic and transparent distribution of royalties and payments, it can help reward independent creators and give them a better chance of monetizing their work.

While the full potential of blockchain technology for intellectual property protection is yet to be realized, it is clear that it has the potential to make a significant difference in the way digital content is created, distributed, and monetized.
